page.title: 12WOODFIELD COUNTY INFANTS'.
page.content: There are 225 children between five and seven years old in Woodfield Infants' School. It is a large building with seven classrooms, a hall and a kitchen. The caretaker looks after the building and keeps it very clean. He also helps by putting up the P.E. apparatus, carrying the milk crates and lifting furniture. The cook has five helpers in the kitchen. They make 200 meals a day for the children and there is no waste because they are so good. A welfare supervisor looks after each class at dinner time. There are two dinner sittings every day and the children sit at octagonal tables. Woodfield Infants' School has a Headmistress, a Deputy Headmistress and 6 full time teachers, 3 part time teachers and 2 ancillary helpers. It is a very happy school.
